actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on January 10, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Schweikert moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor and remembrance of the fallen Capitol Police Officers, Brian D. Sicknick and Howard Liebengood.
The House received a communication from the Honorable Stephanie I. Bice. Mrs. Bice submitted her resignation from the Committee on the Budget. The resignation was accepted without objection.
The House received a communication from Representative Johnson (OH) wherein he wherein he resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective at close of business on January 21, 2024.

Mr. Moore (UT) asked unanimous consent that the order of the House of January 9, 2023, providing for Morning-Hour Debate be extended for the remainder of the 118th Congress, except that H. Res. 950 shall supplant H. Res. 6. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 950 — "Providing for the hour of meeting of the House."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 949 — "To inform the Senate that a quorum of the House has assembled."
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 948, the Chair announced the appointment of Representatives Scalise and Jeffries to the Committee to Notify the President.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 948 — "Providing for a committee to notify the President of the assembly of the House of Representatives."
The Chair designated Mr. Davis of NC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Call of the House Quorum responded: 334 present (Roll no. 1).
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
